programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: James Mays Big Trouble in Model Britain
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ken, head of audio development, is sent on a top-secret mission to capture the sound of a steam locomotive for its potential use in a new model, while marketing and development director Simon Kohler takes on two of his biggest rivals in a dramatic showdown. Plus, the company takes on its first female product designer in the shape of Caitlin Williams

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers find a manmade compartment within the trailer of a truck returning Stateside, and two Americans arouse suspicions with an unsafe lane change at the US-Canada border

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers at Eagle Pass intercept a driver smuggling narcotics over the border, and a group of passengers in Laredo refuse to admit to owning an air compressor full of rifles

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.desc: The motorcycle racer leaves his comfort zone as he attempts to set a world speed record for a hovercraft. These machines are notoriously difficult to control, so to learn the basic skills needed hes put through his paces by Royal Marines in a military training operation. To achieve his goal, Guy will need to stay over 86mph for a kilometre, but at these speeds, because of the hovercrafts inherent instability, even the most experienced pilots can lose control - and the worsening weather makes things much more challenging

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.desc: The motorbike fan takes on the challenge of building the worlds fastest soapbox racer in an attempt to set a new speed record using just the pull of gravity and a tarmac road. To get to grips with going blisteringly fast on a public road, Guy tries his hand at street luge with former global champion Helene Schmit, before joining his team of engineers to explore the science of rolling resistance and the importance of tyre pressure. Armed with what they believe to be the perfect formula, they produce a unique soapbox cart inspired by Mother Nature and, after training with the Team GB womens bobsled pair, confidence is high - but are disaster and mayhem just around the corner?

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers put their lives on the line as they prepare to transfer two members of a cartel. In Laredo, a cop from Caracas, Venezuela, pleads his case for asylum in the United States

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A refugee from war-torn Venezuela tells officers how she paid human traffickers to smuggle her through Central America and to the Mexico-United States border. In Laredo, an American couple caught smuggling methamphetamine inside cans of vegetables crumble while being questioned and give officers information about a chain of so-called stash houses where drugs and illegal immigrants are being kept

programme.title: Train Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: A rusty 10-ton water tank gets cut off of a vintage engine in the Adelaide Hills, and Kuranda Scenic Railway carriages get spruced up by the Queensland Rail carpentry team

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Paddy McGuinness and Chris Harris set out to find interesting old cars for new drivers, then put them to the test on a road trip through Devon and Cornwall. Chris also drives the original supercar, Lamborghinis legendary Miura

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness saddle up the team bus for an RV road trip across Floridas swampy Everglades to hunt down some weird and wonderful local motorsports

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers prepare dishes from their favourite cookery books, explaining their value as social documents that reveal a great deal about people and what they ate. The duo meet Ivan Day, who has one of the most extensive collections of recipe books in the UK, and share stories of renowned food writers such as Elizabeth David and Isabella Beeton

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef witnesses a fishing method frozen in time, where the use of engines and winches is banned, and goes fishing under sail for what he considers to be the best oysters in the world. Back on dry land, Rick cooks a warming fish soup called Cullen Skink, and discovers the all-but-forgotten story of Cornwalls ancient capital, Lostwithiel

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits a deer farm near Bodmin Moor run by Pip and Matt Smith, before returning to the kitchen in Padstow to make a simple venison Wellington. Later, he spends an afternoon on Porthgwarra beach with the artist Hannah Woodman, whose work is inspired by the sea-worn landscape of west Cornwall, before defining the Cornish sense of humour over a pint with comedian Jonny Cowling

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Lucy Beaumont and Desiree Burch, Strictly judge Anton Du Beke and actor Ralf Little join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. Detective drama, starring Trevor Eve

programme.desc: Having witnessed his sister Edie fail several driving tests, Seymour gallantly volunteers to help teach her. However, because he is unable to control a vehicle himself, he needs a qualified motorist to ride along. Michael Aldridge and Thora Hird star

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.desc: A couple inherits a cherished family home, but it needs a major update. Jonathan and Drew open up the main living area for more extended family gatherings

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Matthew and Jericka bought his grandparents house, but while its big enough to grow into, the design is outdated. Jonathan and Drew rework the main living areas

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles is in Loughborough to meet a family of five, whose identical twin babies have been diagnosed as having a form of dwarfism, while at the age of 41, dad Mark is recovering from aggressive bowel and liver cancer. Now they are struggling for space. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team turns up to transform their home, backed up by an army of local tradespeople, with designer Gabrielle Blackman on hand to ensure they dont stray too far from her vision

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Epsom to meet paramedics Sam and Ben Laws, who have two children, one with special needs. The couple already find it hard, working opposite shifts which mean they often dont see each other for days on end - and to make matters worse, they have found their house to be inadequate for their requirements. After a close friend nominates them for the DIY SOS treatment, Nick and the team - bolstered by an army of local tradespeople - turn up to transform it into a home they can enjoy as a family, now and in the future

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles comes to the aid of Liz and Jason Liversidge, a Hull couple in desperate need of help in future-proofing their family home. Not long after getting married and starting a family, Jason was diagnosed with both Fabrys disease, which causes a build-up of poisonous toxins in the body, and Motor Neurone Disease, which drastically reduced his life expectancy. The pair also discovered that Jason would have passed Fabrys disease on to his two daughters, which means that once her husband is gone, Liz will need all the help she can get in managing her childrens condition. Nick joins forces with designer Oliver Heath and an army of volunteers to put together a home in which Jason can build meaningful memories with his girls, but one which also gives Liz the best chance of providing for their future needs

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles is in Loughborough to meet a family of five, whose identical twin babies have been diagnosed as having a form of dwarfism, while at the age of 41, dad Mark is recovering from aggressive bowel and liver cancer. programme.title: MasterChef Junior USA Specials 2023
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay welcomes nine young culinary contestants to cook up seasonal delights. The chefs prepare a dish celebrating holiday traditions, using ingredients hidden in snowmen

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete meets Flower, the first dog ever to take a dislike to him . He also helps Heidi and Marvin, both facing serious medical challenges

programme.title: Louis Theroux - A Place for Paedophiles
programme.desc: The broadcaster reports from Coalinga State Hospital in California, home to more than 500 sex offenders, many of whom have already served lengthy prison sentences and are deemed unsafe for release. During his visit, Louis finds out about a therapy programme run by psychologists who hope to rehabilitate willing participants - but many inmates refuse to take part, with only 13 having completed the course since it began

programme.title: Louis Therouxs Altered States
programme.desc: The documentary-maker explores the changing face of US culture, beginning with a look at a movement in Portland, Oregon, that seeks to broaden how the world views marriage in a time of rising divorce rates, suggesting that monogamy is not essential and that polyamorous or open relationships can be equally fulfilling. However, while Louis meets many who have found happiness with multiple partners, he also discovers tales of heartbreak and jealousy

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The midwives of Liverpool Womens Hospital invite viewers into the delivery suites one last time, introducing 27-year-old Gina and her partner James. The pair met at university, while Gina was on an exchange programme from Shanghai, and made their long-distance relationship work by chatting through cuddly toys via the internet. However, they must now demonstrate their maturity and become parents. Meanwhile, self-confessed baby machine Margy arrives expecting her fifth child, and childhood sweethearts Craig and Sarah, who faced parenthood at an early age, look forward to taking their next baby back to their own home rather than to their parents

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The documentary returns to capture life in the maternity unit at Liverpool Womens Hospital. Students Brooke and Tim, both aged 23, who became inseparable when they met in their first term at university, become parents for the first time and have difficulty deciding on a name for their baby, while things dont go according to plan in theatre for 40-year-old Hayley. She is afraid of being separated from her 23-year-old partner Nick, after he became critically ill during the pregnancy as a result of contracting pneumonia and septicaemia. Meanwhile, Tara, aged 36, has chosen her 16-year-old daughter Courtney as her birthing partner

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Today in Stoke, paramedics Mick and Rachel help a young man who has hurt his back. In Dudley, paramedics help a 74-year-old who had a shock from his internal defibrillator

programme.title: Hungry for It
programme.desc: The cooks level up vegetarian junk food and create a menu of meat alternatives for a packed-out hub, including Team GB medal-winners Kai Whyte and Charlotte Henshaw. In a tense Knives Out, the bottom two cooks must cook a frying pan pizza from scratch in just 15 minutes. At the end of the day, one more cook is sent packing, and just six cooks remain

programme.title: Nick Knowles Big House Clearout
programme.desc: The presenter heads to Hastings to meet Mike, who lives in a small two-up two-down cottage with his four rescue dogs. Mike developed hip problems, has become more housebound, and clutter has been building up around him. Nicks team empty the home and give it a much-needed makeover, turning a cramped dark cottage into a welcoming airy space

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: Homes for Veterans - Part One
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team take on their most ambitious project to date and transform a whole street of run-down empty properties in Manchester into homes for veterans. They are joined by the local community, as well as Prince William and Prince Harry, who volunteer their assistance on site. In the first edition of the two-part special, the team builds houses for two former soldiers who fought in Iraq and Afghanistan and are suffering from post traumatic stress disorder. However, with the number of volunteers lacking and the buildings proving to be trickier than expected, the build is becoming the toughest yet

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: Homes for Veterans - Part Two
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team continue with their most ambitious project to date, with the assistance of the local community and two royal helpers, Prince William and Prince Harry. The second edition sees them create a home for a veteran, who is a triple amputee after an IED blew up in Afghanistan. They are also aiming to renovate the fronts of the houses on the street and put in new utilities, as well as creating a lasting legacy in the form of a support centre, which will help other veterans find homes and jobs

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Holmfirth, West Yorkshire, to meet Richard Ford, a former policeman who suffered a devastating brain-stem stroke in 2012, and is now confined to an electric wheelchair. With limited movement and speech, he communicates with wife Jude and his three sons via an iPad, but has little privacy when it comes to using the toilet. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team and designer Charlie Luxton turn up to transform the familys home, planning to give Richard the privacy he needs while also assisting his recovery

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The stories of two strong women offering their daughters plenty of support during labour after unplanned pregnancies. Twenty-three-year-old Sam went off the rails as a teenager, running away from home and ending up sleeping rough, before meeting her partner Biaggio, and the couple are grateful to have Sams mum by their side. Claire, 20, always knew she wanted her mother to be there in the delivery room, but deciding whether boyfriend Clint should be present wasnt as easy

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance

programme.title: Louis Theroux - A Place for Paedophiles
programme.desc: The broadcaster reports from Coalinga State Hospital in California, home to more than 500 sex offenders, many of whom have already served lengthy prison sentences and are deemed unsafe for release. During his visit, Louis finds out about a therapy programme run by psychologists who hope to rehabilitate willing participants - but many inmates refuse to take part, with only 13 having completed the course since it began

programme.title: Hungry for It
programme.desc: In the Level Up challenge, the cooks must transform basic tinned food into a bougie brunch that blows the mentors socks off. The Service Challenge is pasta, but with a twist. Theres only one rule - no traditional Italian dishes are permitted Guest judge Nathaniel Smith - AKA @TheGrubworksKitchen - has had huge viral hits with some of his mash-up ideas, and the cook who most impresses in the restaurant kitchen will win a live cook-along with Nathan in front of all his followers. For the nail-biting Knives Out challenge, the bottom two cooks must make churros with salted caramel sauce

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys Trans-Siberian Adventure
programme.desc: Joanna concludes her journey across Russia, travelling through deepest Siberia. Along the way, she visits one of the worlds deepest lakes, meets an oligarch and travels to the city where the Russian royal family was killed. Moving on to Moscow, she explores Stalins nuclear bunker, meets some local models and returns to the place where she was photographed in 1966, which first inspired her to take this trip

programme.title: My Kind of Town
programme.desc: Ian Hamilton and his guide dog Major visit Blairgowrie and Rattray in Perth and Kinross. He asks those who live there how they feel about the place and what its future might hold
